objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: A lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows, delivered via spear-phishing.

objects.name: MOD
objects.description: UK Ministry of Defence, targeted by the spear-phishing campaign.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Referenced in the report for documenting RustyClaw.

objects.name: Palo Alto
objects.description: Referenced in the report for documenting SnipBot.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Issuer of the code signing certificate used for the first stage.

objects.name: GlobalSign nv-sa
objects.description: Certificate authority that issued the code signing certificate.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK
objects.description: The threat actor is using DAMASCENED PEACOCK as part of their attack campaign.

objects.name: CVE-2021-44228
objects.description: Not mentioned in the report, but this type is handled.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK." hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76" strings: $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3} condition: (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them }

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call." hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063" strings: $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0} condition: (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them }

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "This rule targets code patterns for pushing the hash onto the stack and then moving the returned pointer into a structure in DAMASCENED PEACOCK." hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063" strings: $ = {68 1A 81 A8 01} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 04} $ = {68 7D 53 AE 52} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 08} $ = {68 59 6F 3C 00} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 0C} $ = {68 6B 9A C6 E1} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 10} $ = {68 32 A9 7C 08} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 14} $ = {68 76 EE 30 8A} $ = {83 C4 04 89 46 18} condition: (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them }

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants used to generate the hash." hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063" strings: $ = {8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9??85F6} condition: any of them }

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern: rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings { meta: author = "NCSC" description = "This rule targets the original name and export name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK." hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063" strings: $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll" $ = "DllExport" condition: (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them }

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with Dynamic Resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
